Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom. Quesadillas marqueza

puaRROFpMgSaM0WpWWkmnA.text: Probably one of the best Mexican palaces i have been to and coming from someone living in the usa that means something,  i suggest that you reserve before coming because it's really popular,  we were two and we were lucky to find a spot without reservations but after us it got really crowded,  service was great food amazing just allaround 5 atars experience.

KGn8CCqiu-5ufZblM6ObDA.text: Fresh, filling, vegetarian friendly and amazingly delicious! My husband and I ate here with our children while traveling in London. I ordered the Sopa de Tortilla - and was given a bowl full of dry tortilla strips. I was somewhat confused about what I had ordered, when a waiter arrived and poured the most delicious soup over top. Everyone else opted to snack on nachos which disappeared quickly. For my meal I ordered the Crepas de Flor de Calabaza; the vegetables inside were cooked perfectly and the flavors were amazing. My husband was very satisfied with his potato and cheese Enchiladas Verdes. The only regret is that the veggie tacos for two were not as kid friendly as we had hoped. There were beans, pico and salsas, and also pickled cactus and Mexican truffles which challenged the kids' adventurous tastes. I tried everything and it was delicious, just not perfect for the kids. The portions were generous and everything we tried was delicious. We left full and happy - I don't think time will allow us to be back for another meal on this trip, but we would return happily.

mb5JF0rxqsuZQo9SwzTHBw.text: Gorgeous Mexican food served by some of the kindest and friendliest staff in the city!We were offered a cramped corner seat which we weren't too pumped about so they let us (party of 2) take a bigger table for 4 and offered to move us as soon as different table cleared out. Tonnes of vegetarian options on the menu all through out. We started with delicious ginger margaritas, recommended by the waitress. We also got to try tamales for the first time (they usually don't come in a vegetarian variety) and their guacamole as a starter was heavenly. For the main we went with the taco tray which was was much fun! You get to assemble your own tacos with a bunch of different ingredient choices. Be sure to ask them for their spicy green sauce on the side - that will really add a kick to the food. The food was phenomenal. the service was perfect and all for a great price. Cannot wait to be back!

1IeEUwiqbbabCT028xCqgg.text: We ate the food because we were hungry and it wasn't horrible, but it also wasn't good, nor in any way exciting.Went to this place because my girl friend had been 2 years ago and raved about it.  Unfortunately she was even more disappointed then I was.  The menu choices were kind of limited - we were hoping for something really interesting, not seen in other Mexican restaurants but it wasn't the case.  At the end we ordered the taco platter, which was quite disappointing.  I would choose Wahaca, Benito's Hat, or Chipotle any day instead of this place.Drinks were OK but very over-priced in my opinion.:( sigh

szyKA_LLC-JpP30ukjOR4Q.text: Being a Texpat, life can certainly be difficult. The extreme lack of Mexican food with any resembling factor of Mexican cuisine is terrible. I try Mexican restaurants with a hopeless attitude. I expect to walk away disappointed, so my attitude is already lost. Today, however, there was a ray of hope. It isn't like being back home 100%, but it is quite good and gives you a comforting feel to the food. Quite good and authentic. The ambiance of the restaurant is a bit upscale. This is in contrast to the typical Mexican Restaurant, but it was a detractor. The food had great flavors. The salsas were quite nice. And free chips (granted there were only like 10 of them) was a nice addition. The lunch prices were quite good. 5-7 pounds for a meal. I appreciated this. All-in-all this is a restaurant worth going a little out of your way for if it is of interest to you.

vdvM1nWfAJgb3_LOj6sUyg.text: We ate at Mestizo for the second time & were incredibly disappointed. We took my dad there for an early Father's Day dinner , & from the beginning I could tell it wasn't going to be great. We had a reservation but they still took a LONG time just to take our drink order. Half of the stuff we wanted they did not have & the waitress (believe she might of even been the owner) looked bothered every time we spoke with her . My dad wanted a dish that apparently was for two people & she was incredibly rude to him because he wanted to order that ! After my husband ordered a drink and it was NOT brought out to him. The food wasn't that great, kind of cold. We later were served by a male staff member he was super nice very friendly & recommended the tres leche cake, that I can honestly say is the ONLY thing I enjoyed there.

xlGEdwJqKpjohsOTkqloMA.text: My friends and my husband and I ate here last night. We got a wide selection of food from the extensive menu. My veg friend and I got the tamales with queso con rajas to start. The tamales are decently sized and served steaming, as all good tamales should be. They tasted very good, with a decent enough serving of queso and rajas. But not spectacular. I've had better in Mexico. We also got guac and chips for the table and that was fine enough. My husband got three horchatas so no complaints there! My friend and I split tacos: one order of nopales and one of flor de calabaza. The orders are served in smallish bowls, but filled almost to the brim, so a great serving size for the price. Also, there is a separate dish offered for an array of spicy sauces. Lovely to look at. But out food was just... fine. The nopales had a bit more of a zing but the flor de calabaza was very bland. The corn tortillas at least were lovely (served hot, thin and didn't fall apart completely when wrapping food). My husband said his pollo con mole was decent but again, nothing to rave over. I admit my bar for Mexican food is very high after living on the Texas-Mexican border. For fantastic Mexican food go to Taqueria in Notting Hill instead. Or even Breddo's Tacos has fabulous fusion creations (although at a much higher price point).

F686s8gHjCTEljGj-XRKFw.text: I really enjoyed it!I especially liked the mole enchiladas - a must get.The tacos al pastor were also very tasty and came with grilled pineapple which may actually work better than raw pineapple. Not for the taco eaters - load them up bc there are only 3-4 toritillas in the little bag and you'll have leftover filling if not!On Yelp reviews' recommendation, I also ordered the Tres Leches cake, It was very tasty but I have to say after the enchiladas and guacamole I should have probably shared with at least 1 person. I couldn't finish it and it was pretty sweet so if you're not into sweet desserts beware!

photos.caption: Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom. Enchiladas mole - indispensable
Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom. 3 leches buen pero muy dulce

B5zedHKawn-jvLA6CqQ4sg.text: If you're reading this, call and make a reservation. They're typically packed we've found. We really like the ambiance, the staff was friendly and helpful. The food was good to great. When in doubt order a salsa that caught your eye. We enjoyed them. They had an ok cadillac margarita. The jaladas, and flautas were good. The queso frito, and tamales costeños were great. Try anything with their cochinta o pollo pibil in it. They have a club downstairs, and a market next door.

EfvPx-Rjv7kAmahxy098Ag.text: Mestiza is all about the Mole - it is muy delicioso!!  Nice staff, good drinks - we'll return during our next visit to London later this year!

7rv2v1Lr-_rBJVG4R5s4-w.text: Really good lunch here - ruthlessly yet not unpleasantly efficient service delivered two excellent enchiladas and the bill well within our allotted hour. We appreciated them pushing to take our order before a big group's although I noticed their lunches had also all arrived in good time. My pork enchilada was great and I would definitely come back - very convenient for visiting Mancunians as it's near Euston!

PQoaDmTO6zGpdQ5SjShreQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place - there were hits and misses but on the whole I think they'd entice me back. Probably because I'm still dreaming about their 50-ingredient house mole sauce which I had served over chicken enchiladas for main! It even contains chocolate which explains the gloriously spicy but sweet flavour that I imagine some might not be a fan of but I loved. It was just a shame I couldn't finish the generously sized portion as it was actually quite heavy. In fact I think most of the main courses were, as my friends had a similar problem - especially the two that decided to share the 'molcajete mestizo' stone bowl speciality and sadly ended up wasting half of it by the looks of things!The quality of the mains was good but I was disappointed by the starters - so that might help you with where to focus your efforts! I'm geekily fussy about topping distribution when it comes to nachos and it's fair to say they were off here (esp the cheese and sour cream). The tortilla chips didn't taste very fresh to me either, and the guac I found disappointingly bland.The servers seemed rushed off their feet with the place heaving even on a Monday eve, though our waitress was nicely efficient to start with, particularly given we were a party of 10. It's worth mentioning it's a very veggie friendly place with even a separate vegan menu upon request. The staff largely disappeared for the second half of our meal though and getting someone over to pay the bill took so long we almost walked out. I'd go back with a smaller party as I don't often find Mexican food that I like in London, and it's all quite reasonably priced. I'd know not to waste time and stomach-space on the starters either (except for maybe the stuffed jalapenos), and I'd like to try one of their tequila flights next time too!

photos.caption: Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom. monday mango margaritas!

wDuNy5b07GATqimiBF0eIQ.text: This is also El Burrito by Mestizo on Deliveroo.  I got the Rajas Con Crema veggie burrito which has the very hard to find (in this part of the world) poblano pepper in it.  Very yummy and I wanted more of it!  Could have done with more heat overall but hey ho, heat tolerance is so subjective!My main critique is the packaging.   They came only partially wrapped in foil (!?), in a cheap, Styrofoam, environmentally unfriendly container.  Burritos should be completely (and tightly) rolled in aluminium foil which makes them super portable, even for a Deliveroo person!  C'mon people - get with it!

m7_lehOs6vArgQruSUJyVw.text: Authentic and excellent Mexican food in London. It's a simple place with friendly service. We started with the flautas and the guacamole. The guacamole was fresh and yum and the flautas were perfectly crunchy and tasteful. For the mains we got the chicken mole enchiladas, the vegetarian and chicken bowls. The chicken mole is made with 25 ingredients one of them being chocolate. I was a bit hesitant but was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. The bowls were huge and can easily feed 3 people. It's a great place for vegetarians as they have a separate menu for it. Highly recommended.

0N33Yiv6p9BQVqojz3ZHhg.text: This is in the top five of the best restaurants I've been to while living in London for just under a year. Not only is the food fantastic but the service is great and unlike sooooooo many other restaurants in London, this one is comfortable and not noisy. You can actually have a conversation - what a novel concept! Back to the food, though. The menu is huge but we ended up getting the guacamole to start, the taco tray which was really fun to eat, the beef molcajete, and two entrees. For four people this was more than enough food. The jalapeno margaritas are tasty as well. I am definitely going back. Really - fantastic place.

-kJDR2ZSNyaVXfK-UqjJlg.text: Where to start? This is by far the best Mexican restaurant I encountered in my 2 years in London. Their signature dishes include their taco tray (pick four kinds of meat and they take care of the accoutrements) and the molcajete (Spanish word for the bowl in which it is served, basically a red or green salsa based soup filled with fajita meat and vegetables to serve into your tortillas). The tequila display is also impressive and the frozen margaritas (can be ordered individually or in pitchers) are on point.If you're looking to save a bit of money, make a reservation for one of their two Sunday brunch sittings. You serve yourself buffet style and will not be disappointed, although I highly advise also doing the aforementioned dinner experience at least once because you will miss out otherwise!

8NocZxjrhzeuk-OtrqdN9A.text: Excellent authentic Mexican food for those who crave it and miss it in London. We went for the Sunday brunch. It was pricey, but worth it. Very nice selection of beef, pork and chicken entrees, as well as the usual sides (rice, beans, soups, fresh tortilla chips, salsas, salads) as well as an excellent taco bar.

qAFf5XwCJoN0DjmZmJ2Snw.text: Coming from California and been living here for 2 years, I could say this is the best Mexican cuisine I tasted so far. I order the beef nortena, salsa Verde, guacamole thru deliveroo. Guacamole from here reminds me of guacamole from SF stores. The nachos are also freshly made. Salsa verde had a nice favour.

h_sWyreX0jvTvRqNebTPDQ.text: Chimichanga was dry and flavorless and didn't come with any of the condiments promised in the description (sour cream, lettuce, pico de gallo, etc.)Totopos were stale and also flavorless.The only good thing was the salsa, which they serve hot (Is this a thing?) but would have been better cold.

N0lO6a704bMq_jzzfDRPgg.text: Yum yum yum...i got a bit carried away and ordered two tacos and two tamales. For girls, the two tacos are enough. I got the pork and pineapple which was amazing...and i also tried the pork shoulder taco. This place is good for big groups too!

QjreDMmMTEOAuxA4-yvvtg.text: I'm a big fan of authentic Mexican food, and it was a great relief to find that there was somewhere else to go after El Mercado in Stoke Newington revised its menu to suit people more used to TexMex. TexMex is fine for lunch, but if I'm going for dinner I'd prefer to have a proper meal. Mestizo usually delivers on this level for me. While cuitlacoche/huitlacoche (corn fungus) is dissapointingly not on the menu, a lot of good Mole's (sauces) are, and the starters are quite good too. I can recommend the Sopa de Tortilla as a starter, which is basically a sour tomato soup served with cream and avocado with strips of tortilla. You mix it together bit by bit and eat. Delicious. The soft tacos as a starter are quite nice and there are a variety of fillings available. Molcajete is probably the principle dish on the menu, but I've not tried it yet (which looks to be very popular), but I'd definitely recommend the Mole Poblano, succulent chicken breast (boiled I think) smothered in a chocolate mole, with rice and refried beans. I have had an issue with the Mole Poblano on occasion where the standard sometimes slips and the chicken breast has been overcooked and the mole not as tasty/spicy as normal.The Mole Verde is quite tasty, but not fantastic. The desserts are very good, the Crepas de Cajeta seem to be actually made with arequipe/dulce de leche not caramel (which is quite a big bonus for me). They also offer a Sunday brunch menu which I've not yet tried, but it does include pericos aka huevos a la Mexicana which are a favourite of mine (basically scrambled eggs with spring onions, tomato, onion and chile). The location is a bit out of the way, but the restaurant itself is quite contemporary looking and modern, the service is usually decent, but not standout and sometimes a bit unfriendly. The great thing about Mestizo is the diversity of food available, I highly recommend this restaurant and indeed, I look forward to experimenting with new flavours on my future visits here. The only reason that I don't give this place 5 stars is that it offers no dishes with cuitlacoche/huitlacoche (a favourite of mine) and the quality of food and service has been known to be a bit inconsistent. Pros- diverse and authentic food- good cocktails- nicely designed restaurant (recently renovated) Cons- service can be a bit inconsistent- food can be inconsistent - bit out of the way

49p4XhjQfB0IwRpB6D_0pw.text: I was feeling home sick after being away from LA for three weeks and in major need of a home made Mexican food fix. When I arrived in London I came across Mestizo as our bus rounded the corner from our hotel (Ibis). Once I got back to our room I immediately searched for it and called to see if it was open and that it hadn't been a mirage. IT WAS! IT WASN'T! My fellow cohorts and I decided to have lunch there on CINCO DE MAYO! I was very surprised that the waitresses were actually from MEXICO, and that the cuisine was better than some of the so called "Mexican" restaurants back in Los Angeles. I had the taquitos dorados (or Flautaus) the first time. Sure they were not the biggest rolled tacos I've had, and the salsa was from a can, but it tasted fresh! The Mexican beer was a great compliment and the Flan was divine to finish of a typical dish you would find in any Mexican restaurant. Loved the decor, just not the prices (then again I was still sticker shocked as it was my first trip out of the US). But it was a small price to pay for a great "home made" Mexican meal. I rate this, four yummy stars only because it did not have the spice factor I was yearning for.

vsALhR9QbmHYduQSUXfx9w.text: My husband and I are visiting from California and decided to try London's Mexican food. We had been warned that Mexican food is not authentic in London but wanted to check that out for ourselves. Well, they were right... I noticed several people mentioned this place as the best Mexican in London, and it might be so comparatively. However, it's not authentic or tasty in general. The chips and salsa were fine, salsa ok. We ordered the red as well as the green veggie enchiladas. The servings were tiny, which is fine, that's usually the case for 'cuisine' style -but the side of black beans was literally about 3 tablespoons! The filling was cold. The tamarindo was good but it would of been nice to get a decent portion rather than a cup full of ice with a splash of tamarindo. The rice was the worst, good texture but very sour, made my teeth hurt and left an aftertaste. The service was not good, very slow, needed to ask for a drink 3 times before it was served. Too bad :(

xvKGILzewojNMf-XfTtKFw.text: This is real Mexican food. Pricey, but nonetheless real, delicious, Mexican food. I recommend it for newcomers to the cuisine. It's fine dining and they have a wide range of tequilla to accompany your meal. Enjoy!

s9e3SbmHgH7oirTS4ppiyA.text: I've found my go-to Mexican restaurant in London.  Makes me want to go back and revise my review of Wahaca down a star.

R3U7pZFuVhE10IBuSoUl4Q.text: I was not disappointed by the service, and the food was great for what it was. I think its definitely the best Mexican in town,

U0H4-W5hWFiCiU2cqbk2BA.text: Proper Latin comfort food and genuine Mexican favourites are difficult to pin down in London while it's overshadowed by nouvelle cuisine and fancier options. So Mestizo's is a little oasis of guacamole and authentic dishes such as the (literally) sizzling hot molcajete. As well as top notch food and service they also pride themselves of having the best tequila in town. So in turn there frozen margaritas are frikkin lethal...infact I blacked out most of the meal after a jug and memories of how yummy it all was came sifting back afterwards. Mos def a good all rounder if you're a fan of Latin grub.

lQEOSqPbfrpgBrmKPVPcEQ.text: It doesn't get any better than this joint on this side of the Atlantic. A bit pricey but amazing! Beautiful, and authentic. If you want the feel of  a posh restaurant in Mexico City, then this is your place. Thursday nights downstairs, it's taco night at the bar. Cheesy Mexican dance music, less expensive food, great drinks, lots of fun.

8b6rXk1kw23TXK7cmCIWwQ.text: By far the best and most authentic Mexican in London. If you are looking for nachos and burritos, this is not the right place for you. This is traditional Mexican cooking at its best. I've spent a lot of time in Mexico and am interested in regional dishes and this place is the beest. Their mole poblano is to die for. And the Sunday brunch can't be beat. The selection is always changing and I've never been disappointed by anything I've tried. It's also the only place in Europe I've ever found that has dishes with the corn fungus huitlacoche, a delicious truffle-like fungus with a rich earthy flavour

D4a9RE9rNo7O7nGETeap1w.text: This must be the closest so far to real Mexican food. The staff is mainly from latin-america and the food is quite good. I would recommend they go for real handmade tortillas and the place would be perfect. Go on a Thursday and stay after your meal to dance and have a good time at their function room. The staff and owners are very friendly.

Mcz47DVxT4UO61jYoyShrg.text: really mexican food¡¡¡ very tasty ..the size of the dishes are small but its ok because of that you ask for more.. and eat exquisite food! go and try it

4f916_LmpHzi5f_IFFR1HQ.text: I echo Hersalek's review - an unmissable restaurant for the most authentic Mexican you will find in London

MhPJI7Ja3JW_m6zITEpTeQ.text: Finding a good Mexican restaurant in London is very difficult. There are plenty of decent burito places, but most every Mexican joint is just plain crap. But even if they had competition, this place still would have knocked the socks off of me. Their staff is friendly, their food fresh, and their prices fair. Took my girlfriend here on a date and she was very impressed. Good atmosphere and great presentation with the food. Would recommend to anyone! Very authentic!

8VgiHkl_NVhQD8OcAMww5A.text: I attended a birthday dinner downstairs at this place and let me tell you, had a great time!!! Although it was a little hard to see because the front is a little hidden, the Marquarita's were superb, although very strong, and the waiting staff were very efficient. The food was delicious but i thought the serving size could have been a little bigger for the price i paid. Other than that it was a great night out! Everyone was very friendly and the atmosphere was charged!

bHNe201SwwvVBFrBbFpLNw.text: Having lived in London for over two years and desperately trying to encounter REAL Mexican food, to finally find Mestizo was like finding Mecca! It's real Mexican with hints of South American and Spanish flavour and style. The best thing on the menu is Molcajete Mestizobeef, chicken or combination (or vegitarian), served in a stone bowl with cheese, chorizo, spring onions, cilantro and avocado and your choice of salsa roja, tomatillo, mole or chipotle. It sounds like fajitas and it is, but the mix of spices and flavour is better than any I've had (and I've had a lot). The tequila selection is huge and despite some criticism of poor service, I've never had a problem with the staff. Bottom lineMestizo is great! BTWif you like El Burrito near Goodge Street station - a take away TexMex place - you'll love Mestizothey're owned by the same people.

2GdHwivslx5NuqSezHBdwA.text: great place to eat. nice chilled out vibe to the place. good food. very filling which is always good! :)

KgirZJx-e2YSo7ic6cuRmg.text: I went her with work for a social night out. I couldn't find better place than this. This is REAL MEXICAN FOOD. tortillas on the side was tasty, the starters great!, my main was delish was tempted to lick the plate!! everything fresh, and the service was amazing. Is the place to go!!! We then ventured downstairs to the tequilla bar, where we danced the night away. Highly recommended!!

s2k3HOBgfqZ4wmLD-D9gSw.text: As others before have said, a real relief to find proper Mexican food in London and to find it served by such nice people. Sunday brunch is fantastic with a giant buffet of lovely stuff and quesadillas, huevos, poblano, etc. made to order. Very relaxed atmosphere, no rush to give up the table and no shortage of plates for return visits to the buffet.

4OSXPnWDuwbAyXAOFNvZpQ.text: Awesome vegan menu, great salsa, but poor Guac

nPyfwInm5hv3dfMHys2uBQ.text: Oh blessed be you, Mestizo.  With your huge menu, delicious margaritas and best of all choices of plates served in, wait for it.... mole sauce! I LOVE mole sauce and they have 3 or 4 dishes you can choose with it's yummy goodness.  Seriously the menu is great, you got to try it out for yourself.It's just the best Mexican food I've found here in London, and if I think of my favorite place for Mexican back in NYC I know if they were side-by-side I'd have to be the peace keeper and alternate between the two!  Hmmm... downsides as every place undoubtedly has, true it is kind of in the middle of nowhere, but it's a short walk from the tube, so we can go eat there and then head off somewhere else if needs be.  The bathrooms are located downstairs, which also happens to be a latino-style dance club.  I ain't go no issue with latino music and getting jiggy with it, but when all I want to do is go to the loo, it's kind of awkwardley planned to have to go through the middle of the dance floor to get there.  Lastly, the last 2 times we've been there, we had this waitress who could make vampira chilly.  I was tempted a bit to lower the rating just on the fact that this waitress couldn't force a smile on her face if her life depended on it.... but with all the good food and the margaritas flowing, we had more than enough fun and smiles around our table that we just ignored her.  Everyone else I have encountered there was pleasant if not downright jolly, so hopefully it will rub off on here someday!

PGo6in8JdZoGAH-ysx39SQ.text: I went here for the Sunday brunch today. There's some quite negative comments about service/attitude below but that's certainly not the experience I had. Maybe it was different as the brunch is buffet based so we weren't getting served at our table, but I'd never had some of the food on offer before so needed some help. The guy on the soup / taco / fajita counter was happy to advise, he brought our food over to the table rather than make us wait at the counter, and made several personal recommendations as to what I should have next. The food - my experience of Mexican is burritos, fajitas and tacos so there was a lot of stuff here I hadn't had before and its all great. Probably the best was spinach enchilada, the black beans, or the courgette cake but I'd have it all again. And great value £19.99 per head for as much food as you want plus one beer or glass of wine, and unlimited soft drinks.

VClDuOUEt7tUiCIR6Tjgpg.text: If you love Mexican or just want to try out some real authentic food then this is the perfect place. I've only been once but it was a great experience. The service was spot on, whenever we needed recommendations a staff member was ready to help. I have to say though, I didn't really like the mole sauce (I am not a huge fan of dark chocolate) but it was my mistake for thinking that for that night only my taste buds would appreciate it. But really loved the starters I had and the Margarita's. It's a small restaurant but I would really recommend it to anyone.

tcs1TQF7-K-mLWmUF574KA.text: Been away from the US for 18yrs....this is the best Mexican food in London.  I have traveled the world and this is a slice of Mexico in the middle of London!

2YnoPi1OK26V923U883yfw.text: On recommendation, and because it's close to a client's, I ventured, full of expectation, down the bleak hinterland of lower Hampstead Rd to find this restaurant. As I neared Mestizo, I saw a group of children in a nearby street throw a glass bottle into the busy road and then wait, watching for a blowout. "Mmm... " I thought. "Nice neighbourhood." This place must be great to get people to schlepp up here. So, it turned out that although the food was good, it wasn't that good, and the service wasn't that bad - it was really bad. Let's start with the food. The quesadillas had a strangely soft and spongy texture, unlike the folded corn or wheat tortilla versions you'd probably be used to. In one of them, the mashed chicken filling was cold. Not lukewarm - cold. It was a first date, I didn't want to reveal myself as the fussy sod I am, so let it slide. Mistake #1. These soft quesadumplings were surprisingly filling, it was pretty late, so we opted to share a main - the signature Molcajete. We explained to the waiter that we were pretty full and would just share a single main course. It's more-or-less a tapas joint, anyway, so this is comme il faut. When it arrived, a half-hour later, we'd already watched, enviously, the dish brought to other tables - the large, deep stone bowl and contents receiving a warm welcome on their arrival. The reason for the half-hour wait was that the waiter, whose English was just around beginner's level, had misunderstood what we said and thought that the quesadillas were enough. Nobody, during our half-hour wait, had thought to drop by and say "would you like something else" or "everything OK?" Mildly embarrassed on discovering his mistake, the waiter ordered the dish and it arrived within five minutes. Did the waiter say "oh, I'm really sorry - let me get you a drink. What would you like?" You guessed it, dear reader, he didn't. We let that slide, too, both of us too eager to appear easygoing. We ate the Molcajete, but the slightly sour taste left by the nonchalant waiter had, by this time, somewhat spoiled the food itself. A note, when ordering the dish. The stone bowl is mostly made of stone, and the part that contains food is around 2/3 of a dessert-spoon deep. So, don't be disappointed. The bill eventually arrived. This was also delayed because someone else, who'd not been charged for their juice or something, had to be hauled back from the kerb to pay. For a glass of cranberry juice, a mixed fruit cocktail, two glasses of wine, four quesadillas and a bowl of stew, we paid £46. I was somewhat surprised to see we'd been charged for the extra tortillas we'd needed for the Molcajete, but I realised that trying to explain why this wasn't so appropriate, in light of the rest of our dining experience, would be an utter waste of time. I'd recommend this place for diners who: a) are really too drunk to careb) are really too rich " " c) are really too Spanish to be misunderstood when ordering food. Try Wahaca. A friend of mine said that it's not as "authentic" but you'll get fed on time, I suspect and, chances are, your waiter may look you in the eye when he's taking your order.

vKCcGNWLIFiWA4G06FAHLw.text: This is the best Mexican food I have had in London. It is simply delicious .... Also if you like tequila ..  this place is heaven .....Check out Thursday night, they have live DJ and nice tacos in their basement. Their music is very groovylicioussssssssssss....... It is very enjoyable ....I will surely be back for more.

4HDhSxhpG4TuKx3_b9v2KQ.text: Definitely the best Mexican in london. If you love your tortillas and Mexican spices, head this way.

xS8IogviMAukalj3qH543g.text: Terrible terrible Mexican food! Overpriced!!!  I had the pescadillos (sp) for my starter, and hated it.  I then got the "king" prawn and rice entree... for £16 what i got was frozen shrimp and white rice and some carrots.  If it at least tasted good, it wouldnt have been so bad.  It sucked!!! I give one star because the magaritas were awesome!!  I came during happy hour so I got two for one.  However, because I couldn't eat any of the food (did i mention i didnt bother eating my £30 meal) I felt woozy after barely finishing my first drink.

PmvjhzIl4lyCfhpS_9cjaQ.text: With respect to transparency, I must declare my love of Mexican food. It is my desert island cuisine and I could eat it every day. The location of this place is a honey trap on the way home from work, so I should wish to eat there at least once a week.... So, to Mestizo... Hmm... The food is good. I am told by more knowledgable and travelled folk that it is reasonably authentic, and the staff all appear to be of Hispanic descent. There is a good variety of Mex dishes - all your usual stuff, together with some fun sharing platters. The restuarant is lacking atmosphere, but it is nice and bright and they can seat quite a few people for its unusual location on Hampstead Road. It is actually split over two floors (not that you would know that from the street). So, I should love it, right? Problem is, to get to my beloved tacos and HUGE frozen margi I have to navigate a long wide load of attitude. You think they would be thankful for people paying well over the odds for a bean and cheese quesadilla, however it always seems to come with a side of surly. By all means try it out, but I warn you that it isn't the warmest reception whatever formation you arrive in (I've been 6+ times - work events, dinner dates, to watch the World Cup for their Mex festival). There is a severe lack of good Mexican restaurants in London, so they could easily vie for the prize, but instead they seem to be doing their best to turn people away. Gutted.

RKWJxLqObhsHAbuFCSFFyg.text: A Mexican restaurant run by Mexicans. This is really rare in London. Try the molcajete - chicken or beef served in a stone bowl, with salsa roja, cheese, chorizo, spring onions, coriander, avocado and tortillas. Really excellent. Service can be slow if it's busy, but generally this is one of the best mexican places in London. If you are used to good mexican food (ie you have lived in Mexico or the USA), then you should definitely check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom

1MpptVW6PnhBibPv5w7ApQ.text: Been to Mestizo many times over the years and it has always been great.  If you are searching for a fantastic Mexican restaurant in London, then this is it.  Please note that it is proper Mexican and not Tex/Mex.  It has never disappointed.  The food is excellent and the drinks are great too.  Please only tell your best friends about it :-).  One of my favourite restaurants in London.

dRnjjBIddgUUhYz0cI0b-A.text: One word: Yum! And the service is super friendly. Slight minuses: cocktails are a mixed bag, the toilets could be cleaner and the Sunday buffet is mixed depending on the day. I don't love the decor. But who cares, when the food is this great? Everything else is a plus. The food is unparalled for Mexican cuisine in London. We love that ingredients are available to purchase to make food at home. I love the all-you-can-drink horchata for the Sunday buffet, as well as the odd "chilli pepper month" or "margarita month" that they host, with special menus. My only complaint is having to wear elastic-waisted trousers to accomodate the expansion after gorging myself on the food.

ePD5Vzf4J79d-EluW67-Bg.text: I came to know about Mestizo when i read a review praising it for its good and authentic Mexican food. Now i don't really put much value on the authenticity of the cuisine (as long as it tastes ok), but i decided nevertheless to give it a try. So the next day i made my friends get me here for my birthday dinner.The restaurant is located a bit off the beaten track ... about 5 minutes from Euston station. One wonders why they chose to open their business in an otherwise empty, residential area.But the location does not seem to deter customers. Even on a tuesday evening they were more than half full. The table organization at the place seemed a bit odd to me. The tables were packed closely together although there was quite a bit of empty space elsewhere in the hall.I started with the tamales. I had never tried these before ... and i guess boiled corn husk doesn't agree with me. I liked the fillings though. My friends ordered some spicy nachos and it certainly was one of the best nachos that i can remember. They had used a lot of cheese, which had made the nachos quite soggy ... just the way i like it.For the main course i had the "Mole huasteco". The dish comprised of chicken breast served with huasteco sauce (which tasted similar to, but better than, normal barbecue sauce) and rice and beans. This preparation was outstanding. I liked everything here ... the rice, the chicken, the beans and the sauce. Maybe it could have been a bit spicier, but i enjoyed what i got. The dish looked small, but was quite filling. The same held true for my friends' orders ... enchiladas with potato and cheese and "chile rellenos" (which was pepper stuffed with a variety of things, including courgette flour, corn and cheese). All the 3 main courses were came with beans and rice.A starter, a very filling main course, and a drink ... all these together cost us ~£20 per person. This isn't very cheap, but you get good value for what you pay. Will be back to try some more unusual mexican dishes here.

hXOddKseqtiLnkXQOjwg6g.text: 6 of us popped in here on a Thursdsy night intending to take advantage of the happy hour and to eat. First we were told only corona beer. This only changed when we let it be known we might go elsewhere. I got the distinct impression that they didn't want to save the full advertised range of beer, money saving. Then we were hassled for a food order and waited and waited for our drinks and continued to be hassled for a food order. After about 10 minutes and no sign of drinks we gave up and left. Shame as I've always enjoyed this place. If this is their new style of customer service they need to have a re think!

onRdfZeJG1fIt1luY20xcQ.text: The best Mexican food I've been able to find in London.  The tamales were really good and staff is friendly.  It's also very reasonably priced.

6KMKAn53uqroQQgs2_ludg.text: Hands down the best Mexican style food in London. Fresh, tasty and so many dishes to choose from, love the taco tray and their slow roasted pork reminds me what I love about arepas. Very nice deco and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom

Y_ebDxcmu1sFoiyAp3o8VA.text: I went here for Sunday lunch a few months ago as they do an all you can eat lunch, with as much wine and beer as you like, and that seemed like a good idea. It wasn't. The food was ok  though the vegetarian offerings were more minimal than the website suggested  but the main issue was that the service was pretty surly, we had the strong impression that they resented us for not being Mexican and we got significantly worse service than anyone else there.

aeDIbTj9tZNataIYgUi4uw.text: I went here recently for a friend's birthday and we all had a great time. Unlike many other Mexican restaurants the food was definately above average and had an authentic flavour. The staff were more than happy to recommend dishes and also explain the ingredients. I went for the Mole Huasteco, a traditional Mexcan chicken served with beans and rice and my friends went for the taco trays which looked delicious. Don't go to Mestizo if you've eaten well during the day because you won't have room to taste the generous portions. After our meal we ventured downstairs to the bar and continued drinking- the perfect end to my friend's birthday dinner. I don't remember too much about teh rest of teh night so I guess we had a good time!

photos.caption: Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mestizo - London, United Kingdom

P0IAMSveM3UgCmravacdxw.text: I visited this place last night with a mixed group of nationalities including an American (me) and a friend from Mexico City. On the whole, a good experience, with our Mexican friend swearing it lived up to her expectations of a proper meal in Mexico City.I'll echo some earlier reviewers - this is not Cali-Mex / Tex-Mex. So, don't expect Burritos. Instead, the focus is on proper mexican mains. If I'm being honest, I've had better proper Mexican Food in North America - but by London standards, this is pretty tasty. (One exception - the Guacamole was pretty meh)I would say, that my only complaint has to do with service/attention to detail. My main was luke warm, dirty starter plates were delivered, my water glass revealed stuck on food. Again, the taste was spot on - but they could use a bit of work elevating the whole experience. I noticed several other reviewers comment on the cold food - seems like something the owners should work on.
